label: Animal
definition: Any attribute of a particular animal or a definied group of animals individuals

label: Caste
definition: The society division that is specialized in the function it performs and is distinguished by anatomical or morphological features from other individuals of in the society
notes: Recommended best pratices is to use a controlled vocabulary

label: Plant
definition: Any attribute of a particular plant or a defined group of plants inviduals

label: Anther Dehiscence Type
definition: The physical mechanism of anther dehiscence (release of the pollen grains)
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary

label: Flower Abundance
definition: The number of open flowers or inflorescences on the plant
notes: If it is an estimate then you should describe the accuracy of the measurement using http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/measurementAccuracy

label: Floral Symmetry
definition: The symmetry describing whether, and how, a flower, in particular its perianth, can be divided into two or more identical or mirror-image parts.
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Phenotype and Trait Ontology

label: Floral System
definition: The system by which bisexual flowers optimize their reproductive success, through mechanisms that promote self- or cross-pollination
notes:
It can be a morphological, temporal or movement-based mechanism.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Plant Habit
definition: The general appearance, characteristic form, or mode of growth of the plant

label: Human Use
definition: Ways in which species are utilized by people, including cultural use
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Mating System
definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of the modes of gene transfer from one generation to the next through sexual reproduction
notes: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ) and to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Self Incompatibility Type
definition: The type or class of self-incompatibility system of the plant species
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. If the plant has no self-incompatibility system use the value `absent`.

label: Apomitic System Embryo Origin
definition: The general mode of apomixis embryo origin of a plant
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Apomitic System Fertilization
definition: The general mode of apomixis endosperm development of a plant
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Apomitic System Reproduction
definition: The general mode of apomixis reproduction of a plant
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Sexual System
definition: The distribution of floral types within and among the individuals of the same population
notes: The gender expression is based in the presence and distribution of fertile whorls within the flower. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary

label: Flower
definition: Any attribute of a particular flower or a definied group of flowers
examples: The shape and the number of anther of a flower

label: Anther Pollen Grains Quantity
definition: The total number of pollen grains in the anther(s) of a flower
notes: For flowers with multiple anthers the number provided should be the sum of pollen grains in all anthers

label: Stigmatic Area In Square Milimiters
definition: The total surface area in square millimeters of the stigma of a flower

label: Style Length In Milimiters
definition: The length in milimiters from the base to the tip of the style of a flower

label: Colored Flower Structure
definition: The predominant colored structure(s) of the flower(s)
notes:
Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Flower Color
definition: The predominant color(s) of the flower(s)
notes:
Recommended best practice is to separate the values with space vertical bar space ( | ).

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Flower Shape
definition: The overall shape of the flowers
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Flower Orientation
definition: The orientation (presentation) of the flower with respect to the flower or inflorescence main axis
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Flower Opening Type
definition: The type of flower describing whether the flower's corolla opens or not, exposing its reproductive parts
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label: Floral Attractants
definition: Types of attractants (visual, chemical or tactile) present in the flowers that floral visitors may use to locate them and their resources
notes: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ) and to use a controlled vocabulary

label: Ovule Quantity
definition: The total amount of ovules in a flower

label: Flower Longevity
definition: The total amount of hours comprising the time between flower opening and flower senescence
notes: A flower is considered opened when its petals are fully open regardless of anther maturation and stigma receptivity, and flower senescence is when floral parts begin to wilt and fall off or the ovary starts to develop into fruit

label: Flower Opening Period
definition: The time or interval during which a chasmogamous flower opens exposing its reproductive parts
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a time interval that conforms to ISO  8601-1:2019.

label: Functional Flower Lifespan In Hours
definition: The total amount of hours during which a flower is sexually functional
notes: The period of time when stigma is receptive to the germination of pollen grains, ovules are receptive to the pollen tubes or anthers present viable pollen grains

label: Interaction
definition: An interaction event that occurs at some location during some time.
examples: A bee visits a flower of a plant

label: Visited Flower Sex
definition: The sex of the visited flower
notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary

label: Animal Place Of Contact
definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of the animal body parts that contact the plant during the interaction
notes: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( `|` ) and to use a controlled vocabulary

label: Nectar Collecting Body Part
definition: The animal body part used to collect nectar from the plant nectaries
notes: The plant nectaries can be floral or extrafloral nectaries. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as Uberon or the Hymenoptera Anatomy Ontology

label: Nectar Collecting Body Part Length In Milimiters
definition: The length in millimeters of the body part used to collect nectar from the plant nectaries
notes: If reporting this value, the `nectarCollectingBodyPart` should also be provided.

label: Flower Place Of Contact
definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of flower parts touched by the animal during the interaction
notes: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( `|` ) and to use a controlled vocabulary

label: Resource Collected
definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of floral resources used or removed from the visited flower(s) during the interaction
notes: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( `|` ) and to use a controlled vocabulary

label: Visited Flowers Quantity
definition: The total number of flowers visited during the interaction

label: Reproductive Success
definition: A reproductive success measurement as a result or a effect of the interaction(s) on the subject or object of the interaction
usage: The mass of a fruit exposed to multiple visitors was 100 grams
notes: An outcome is related to one or more interactions, but limited to the same subject or object of the related interactions (e.g. a dwc:Occurrence or a dwc:Taxon)
examples: The mass of a fruit exposed to multiple visitors was 100 grams

label: Number Of Removed Pollen Grains
definition: The total number of pollen grains removed from the anther(s) of the visited flower(s)
notes: The pollen grains may have been removed by multiple floral visitors. The number should include pollen grains from all anthers of the flower(s)

label: Number Of Conspecific Pollen Grains
definition: The total number of conspecific pollen grains deposited on the stigma(s) of the visited flower(s)
notes: The pollen grains may have been deposited at the end of the flower(s) anthesis by multiple floral visitors

label: Number Of Heterospecific Pollen Grains
definition: The total number of heterospecific pollen grains deposited on a the stigma(s) of the visited flower(s)
notes: The pollen grains may have been deposited at the end of the flower(s) anthesis by multiple floral visitors

label: Number Of Fertilized Ovules
definition: The total number of fertilized ovules in the visited flower(s)
notes: The ovules may have been fertilized as a result of multiple floral visits

label: Number Of Pollen Tubes
definition: The total number of pollen tubes growing in the style(s) of the visited flower(s)
notes: The flower(s) may have been exposed by multiple floral visitors. The number should include pollen tubes growing from all styles of the flower(s)

label: Seed Mass In Miligrams
definition: The total mass in miligrams of the seeds of mature fruit(s)
notes: If reporting this value, the `seedSet` should also be provided.

label: Seed Set
definition: The total number of seeds of mature fruit(s)
notes: If reporting this value, the `fruitSet` should also be provided.

label: Fruit Mass In Grams
definition: The total mass in grams of the fruit(s)
notes: If reporting this value, the `fruitSet` should also be provided.

label: Fruit Set
definition: The total number of mature fruits of the exposed flower(s)
notes: If reporting this value, the `numberOfExposedFlowers` should also be provided

label: Number Of Exposed Flowers
definition: The total number of flowers exposed to floral visitors
notes: The exposed flowers are the flowers monitored to measure the reproductive success of the plant(s). For the total number of flowers available to floral visitors (including flowers unmonitored) use `flowerAbundance`.

label: Nectar Dynamics
definition: The measurements of nectar dynamics
usage: The accumulated nectar in the monitored flowers
notes: A nectar dynamics measurement is related to the plant occurrence(s)
examples: The accumulated nectar in the monitored flowers

label: Accumlated Nectar Volume In Microliters
definition: The total volume in microliters of nectar accumulated by the flower(s)
notes: The total volume of nectar should be provided for flowers which were not exposed to floral visitors during all their longevity. If reporting this value, the `accumulatedNectarHours` should also be provided.

label: Accumulated Nectar Concentration
definition: The concentration of the nectar, in percentage of sugar, accumulated by the flower(s)
notes: The accumulated nectar concentration should be provided for flowers which were not exposed to floral visitors during all their longevity. If reporting this value, the `accumulatedNectarHours` should also be provided

label: Accumulated Nectar Hours
definition: The time in hours in which the nectar was let to accumulated in the flower(s)

label: Accumulated Nectar Flowers
definition: The total number of flowers which the accumulated nectar measurements were made
notes: The flowers should be prevented from visitation (not exposed to floral visitors) during all their logenvity
